thread.title: How a nomination for a young farmer can kick start an agricultural career

author: Lewis Clarke
title: How a nomination for a young farmer can kick start an agricultural career
text:
How a nomination for a young farmer can kick start an agricultural career Tiverton's Richard Tucker explains how his award has helped propel him up the farming ladder Share Richard Tucker on his farm in Mid Devon Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Last year’s winner of the Devon Farm Business Awards’ Best Young Farmer is calling those involved in agriculture to help launch farming careers. 
Richard Tucker from Ditchett Farm at Long Drag near Tiverton has said a nomination can help give a kick-start up the farming ladder. 
“Winning the award has opened up new opportunities for me and has helped to raise the profile of the business. 
“It was a great honour to be nominated by someone I respect and to know that they felt I was a worthwhile candidate. Read More Dairy farmers in South West facing Brexit recruitment 'cliff edge', industry survey warns 
Devon Farm Business Awards, now in their fifth year, highlight the excellence and dynamism of farming in Devon and are organised by the Addington Fund, the Devon County Agricultural Association (DCAA) and leading regional solicitors Stephens Scown. 
Richard, 33, and his parents Nigel and Brenda run a thriving dairy farm business and have a traditional grazing herd of 240 Friesian/Jersey cross breeds and supply milk to Arla. Farm buildings at Ditchetts in the Mid Devon countryside 
“I encourage anyone involved in Devon agriculture to give another young farmer a kick-start up the farming ladder,” added Richard. 
There are six categories for which farmers can enter or be nominated: best commercial farmer, best dairy farmer, best woman in farming, the CAVV John Neason Farm Diversification Award, Devon’s farming champion and best young farmer. Read More Search under way for 2018 Devon Farm Business Awards winners 
In addition, the judges will choose Devon’s Farmer of the Year from among the category winners and also present a Lifetime Achievement award. The awards will be announced and presented at a prestigious dinner on the eve of the Devon County Show, which this year runs from May 17-19. 
Nominations for the awards close on March 16 and forms are available from the Addington Fund www.addingtonfund.org.uk /events. Like us on Facebook
